page.title: 10TRANSPORT AROUND GLADESTRY
page.content: The main road that goes through Gladestry is a B-road. But all around there are single track lanes. The main road goes from Burlingjobb to Erwood. Our nearest A-road is at Burlingjobb. It ends at Aberystwyth. Most of the roads are single track. They are narrow and dangerous. People need cars because there is only one shop. It is six miles to the shops in Kington. There is a bus to Kington once a week. The nearest railway is Knighton, but the nearest mainline railway is Hereford. In winter Daihatsus, Land-Rovers, and Range-Rovers are useful in the snow because they are four-wheel drive. It is often difficult to get to school in winter because the snow blocks the roads.
